etymology.description: 不 (not) + 得 (be permitted/able) = must not; cannot; unable to.
etymology.interpretation: Formal/literary negation used in prohibitions or statements of inability, often as 不得 + V. In everyday speech it's often replaced by 不能 or 不可以 for 'may not'.

parts.english: to obtain; to be allowed/able (literary); auxiliary for possibility

examples.chinese: 此处不得停车(此處不得停車)。
未经许可不得入内(未經許可不得入內)。
因病不得参加比赛(因病不得參加比賽)。
examples.english: Unable to take part in the competition due to illness.
